business.headline: Va Tech Wabag shares: Why VA Tech Wabag stocks are in focus?As of 2:50 PM, the shares were trading at Rs 1,655.15, down 12.20% from the previous close. Earlier in the day, the stock dropped to Rs 1,586.50 on the NSE, marking a 15.8% decline.
NMDC share price falls over 6% today. Here's whyShares of NMDC and steel firms fell as Karnataka proposed a mining tax bill, impacting iron ore costs and profitability across the sector.
Rs 880 crore unclaimed: Is your LIC policy among them? Here's how to checkOver Rs 880 crore in LIC maturity benefits remain unclaimed by nearly 3.72 lakh policyholders in FY24.

Stock market crash: 3 reasons why Sensex, Nifty are under pressure todayThe S&P BSE Sensex declined by 612.55 points, or 0.76%, to 80,071.90, while the NSE Nifty50 shed 179.55 points, or 0.74%, to 24,156.45 as of 12:50 PM.

Explained: Why Enviro Infra share price fell 10% in early trade today The decline in Enviro Infra's share price comes on the same day the company is set to announce its financial performance for the quarter ended September 30, 2024.
Mobikwik shares make bumper debut: Should you book profit? Mobikwik share price: The stock of Mobikwik opened on the BSE at Rs 442.25, listing at a premium of 58.51% over the issue price of Rs 279.

Sai Life Sciences shares debut at 18% premium on stock exchanges Sai Life Sciences share price today: Sai Life Sciences shares made a strong debut on Wednesday, listing at a premium of 18% on the NSE, with the stock opening at Rs 650, which is Rs 101 above its issue price.

Bumper debut for Mobikwik shares as stocks list at 59% premium on Dalal StreetMobikwik share price: The shares of One Mobikwik Systems debuted on the BSE at Rs 442.25, marking a 58.51% premium over the issue price of Rs 279.
Vishal Mega Mart shares make strong market debut at 33% premium on D-Street Vishal Mega Mart share price: The stock began trading at Rs 104, at a premium of 33% over its issue price of Rs 78.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as cautious investors weigh global trendsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 15.56 points to 80,668.89, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 4 points to 24,332.00.

Facebook owner Meta hit with 251 million euros in fines for 2018 data breachIreland's Data Protection Commission issued the penalties to Meta after wrapping up its inquiry into the breach, when hackers gained access to user accounts by exploiting bugs in the platform's code.

Cryptocurrencies to be taxed as capital gains: Relief for pre-FY23 earningsThe Income Tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT) decision defines cryptocurrencies as capital assets, distinguishing pre-2022 profits as capital gains and applying a 30% flat tax to post-2022 transactions.

Income Tax Department admits error of sending wrong ITR notices. Check details The Income Tax Department has acknowledged its mistake in sending defective ITR notices, offering relief to many, though taxpayers who filed revised returns could face complications.

Will India's economic growth pick up pace? Nirmala Sitharaman answersFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman acknowledged that July to September was a challenging period for the economy but called the slowdown a 'temporary blip'.

Dormant account? Here's how to easily reactivate it at SBI, PNB and 2 more banksKeep your bank account active with periodic transactions and KYC updates. Reactivate dormant accounts at HDFC, PNB, SBI, and IDFC FIRST Banks with simple steps.

Sensex plunges over 1,000 points as bearish sentiment grips marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 1064.12 points to end the day at 80,684.45, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 332.25 points to close at 24,336.00.
EPFO members may soon approve their own PF withdrawals: ReportCurrently, withdrawing PF funds involves multiple checks and balances, with subscribers required to submit forms and wait for approvals.
EPFO high pension: Why have 1.7 million applied for higher EPS contribution?Launched in 1995, the Employees' Pension Scheme (EPS-95) offers social security to organised sector employees.

ITC shares rise as ITC Hotels demerger set for January 1, 2025: Key detailsITC Hotels demerger announcement came after the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT), Kolkata Bench, approved the scheme of arrangement between ITC and ITC Hotels.

How big corporates are choking middle class, hurting India growth storyThe government gave tax relief to private companies in 2019 hoping they would invest in people and infrastructure. It was counterproductive. Big corporates pocketed profits and froze real wages of employees. Here's why the government should take a decisive step to ensure more money in the hands of the middle class to boost India's growth story.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Trinamool MP moves privilege notice against Amit Shah over Ambedkar remarksTrinamool MP Derek O'Brien said that the remarks by Union Home Minister Amit Shah undermined the legacy of Dr BR Ambedkar and the dignity of the House.
Umar Khalid gets 7-day bail in 2020 Delhi riots case to attend family marriageDelhi Court grants 7-day bail to Umar Khalid in Delhi riots conspiracy case to attend marriage in family

Congress and its rotten ecosystem: PM hits back as BR Ambedkar row intensifiesAmbedkar row: As Congress sought the resignation of Amit Shah over his remarks on Ambedkar, PM Modi accused the party of trying to obliterate the legacy of the architect of the Constitution.

Priyanka Gandhi likely to be on One Nation One Poll Parliament panel: SourcesThe government will send the One Nation One Election (ONOE) bills to a Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC) for a broader consultation after those were admitted in the Lok Sabha following a vote.

First OBC commission wanted 70% reservation. Why Nehru govt junked itHome Minister Amit Shah spoke about the long-forgotten Karlelkar Commission report to brand Congress "anti-reservation". Set up in 1953 by the President, it was India's first Commission on backward classes. What did the Nehru-era panel recommend, and why didn't the government junk its recommendations?

What made R Ashwin retire midway through the crucial Australia seriesR Ashwin decided to bring down the curtains on his glorious career that made him a legend in Indian cricket. We take a look at the reasons why Ashwin decided to make the shock call to end his international career.

Free healthcare for 60 and above: Arvind Kelriwal's second big poll promiseAnnouncing the 'Sanjeevani' scheme, Arvind Kejriwal said that any resident of Delhi, above 60 years, will get free healthcare services under the scheme. The entire cost of treatment will be born by the Delhi government, Kejriwal said.

Congress seeks Amit Shah's resignation over Ambedkar 'fashion' remarkSeveral opposition MPs, including Rahul Gandhi, staged a protest in Parliament demanding Amit Shah's resignation for his Rajya Sabha remarks that they claimed were an insult to Ambedkar.
Malaysian woman, 67, loses Rs 4 crore in 7-year love scam, never met 'partner'The ordeal began in October 2017 when the victim connected with the scammer on Facebook.

Bangladesh court cancels death for Ulfa chief Paresh Baruah in arms-haul caseA Bangladesh court has acquitted six people, including a former minister, and reduced the death sentence of Ulfa chief Paresh Baruah in connection with the sensational 2004 arms-haul case. Ten truckloads of arms and ammunition meant for anti-India terrorists were seized in Chattogram.

US announces H-1B visa overhaul to fill jobs faster; Indians may benefit mostThe Department of Homeland Security (DHS) has announced its decision to modernise the H-1B visa programme, effective January 17, 2025. The aim is to streamline and expedite the H1-B visa approval process and provide greater flexibility for employers to retain top talent. Indians are likely to benefit the most.

Not the end: Aamir Khan Productions on Laapataa Ladies missing Oscars shortlistAamir Khan Productions, along with Kiran Rao's Kindling Productions, reacted to Laapataa Ladies missing the Oscars shortlist. In a statement, they expressed their disappointment but emphasised that they do not see it as the end.

Binaca Geetmala and the Kishore Kumar-Indira Gandhi rift that led to his banBinaca Geetmala, the iconic radio show that defined Indian music for over 40 years, found itself mired in politics during the 1975 Emergency, when a Kishore Kumar-Indira Gandhi rift led to a radio ban on the voice of the King of Bollywood playback singing.

Freebies, cash and lots of personal touch: Kejriwal's campaign cocktail for DelhiAs the BJP mounts a stiff challenge and the Congress threatens to split votes, Arvind Kejriwal dons the 'magician' hat to declare AAP will deliver on all its promises
Inside Operation Prahar, India's big op to end Naxalism by 2026In a major push towards eliminating Naxalism from India, the government has aimed to make the country Naxal-free by 2026.

R Ashwin retires from international cricket: Bit of punch left in meIndia off-spinner R Ashwin announced his retirement from all formats of cricket on Wednesday after the end of the third Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Rohit Sharma confirmed R Ashwin had hinted about his retirement at the start of the series.

So much sunlight, yet Indians suffer from lack of vitamin D: Why?Modern lifestyles, cultural habits, and environmental factors are key reasons why Indians have a deficiency of vitamin D, despite excessive sunlight.
Video: Japan's private Kairos rocket explodes minutes after launchJapan's Space One announced that the mission could not be completed successfully, prompting an immediate halt to the flight.

Video: Noida woman slaps boy for arguing with son, slaps person filming herIn a clip that is going viral, the woman can be seen slapping the person who is recording the video and is even heard threatening to hit the child again if she found him alone.

Ashwin made the decision right after the Gabba Test ended in a draw.
Bharat NCAP 5-star safety rating only for these 2 Indian compact SUVsThe compact SUV segment has a share of almost 30% in the total car sales in India.
Why do India and China have single time zones?India follows a single time zone called Indian Standard Time (IST), which is set at GMT+5:30.

Farmers stage 'rail roko' protest in Punjab after 'Dilli Chalo' attempts crushedFarmer leader Sarwan Singh Pandher confirmed that the protest is part of their ongoing agitation that began on February 13 when security forces stopped farmers' marches to Delhi at the Shambhu and Khanauri border points between Punjab and Haryana.

Delhi Lt Governor asks Atishi to convene Assembly session on Dec 19-20Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena on Wednesday asked Delhi Chief Minister Atishi to convene a special session of the Delhi Legislative Assembly on December 19-20 to discuss 14 pending Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) reports.

Uorfi slams Pratyusha Banerjee's ex-boyfriend Rahul Raj SinghUorfi criticised TV actor Rahul Raj Singh for referring to her as a 'cartoon' in a social media post, reminding him of the controversy surrounding late Pratyusha Banerjee's death.

Shiva Shakti: Naga Chaitanya, Sai Pallavi's Thandel song to be launched in VaranasiThe second single, Shiva Shakti, from Naga Chaitanya, Sai Pallavi's Thandel, will be launched on December 22. The song will be released in Varanasi.

UI actor Reeshma Nanaiah on comparisons with Sreeleela: Want to be a good artisteUpendra's UI, which is slated to release on December 20, has been gaining a lot of attention as it approaches release. In an exclusive chat with India Today Digital, actor Reeshma Nanaiah her thoughts on comparisons between her and Sreeleela of Kissik fame.
Why did Shruti Haasan walk out of Adivi Sesh's Dacoit?Shruti Haasan has walked out of Adivi Sesh's Dacoit for multiple reasons. Mrunal Thakur replaced Shruti in the film, directed by Shaneil Deo.

Kohli and Ashwin shared a warm embrace on the off-spinner's last day as an international cricketer.

R Ashwin retires: Nothing but respect for him, says Australia's Nathan LyonAustralia off-spinner Nathan Lyon heaped praise on his Indian counterpart R Ashwin, who announced his retirement from all forms of international cricket on Wednesday. Lyon said he had "nothing but respect" for Ashwin and hailed his skillset as "incredible."

In stats: R Ashwin ends international career as one of the greatest spinnersStar off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin ended his India career with a total of 765 international wickets from 287 matches. Ashwin is bowing out of the game as the country's second-highest wicket-taker in Tests.

The hosts had posted a target of 275 runs for India to chase but the weather would force an early close to the game on Wednesday, December 18.

Virat Kohli helps Rohit Sharma, Mohammed Siraj plot Steve Smith's downfallVirat Kohli played the role of the mastermind as the Indian star helped captain Rohit Sharma and Mohammed Siraj get the wicket of Steve Smith on Day 5 of the Gabba Test. Smith was once again caught down the leg side.

Gukesh will pick and choose tournaments, focus on defending world title: FatherChess World Championship: Speaking to India Today, D Gukesh's father Rajinikanth said the youngest world champion will pick and choose his tournaments next year and work towards defending his world championship title. Rajinikanth acknowledged Tamil Nadu government's support to help the sport grow in the state.

Stand at Eden Gardens named after Jhulan: 'It will motivate young cricketers' Legendary fast bowler Jhulan Goswami expressed her honour at the Cricket Association of Bengal's gesture to rename a stand at the iconic Eden Gardens after her. The former India cricketer added that the stand would inspire many young women cricketers

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
